title: In winning F1 title, Norris proves himself (and his doubters) wrong
content: Lando Norris doubted himself as a title contender earlier this year. Now, as the curtain falls on the F1 season, he can call himself a world champion.

title: Watch: Rahul Gandhi questions EC, slams RSS, warns of threat to democracy in Lok Sabha
content: Rahul Gandhi delivered a blistering speech in the Lok Sabha during the election reforms debate, accusing the government and the Election Commission of institutional capture, raising concerns over ‚Äúvote chori,‚Äù and questioning changes to key electoral laws. He also criticised the RSS, celebrated India‚Äôs democratic spirit, and proposed urgent reforms to protect free and fair elections.

title: IndiGo flight cuts to spike airfares in peak season, leave passengers with few options
content: Back-of-the-envelope calculations indicate that reducing daily flights from 400 to 500 will affect 65,000 to 81,000 daily passengers, who had probably booked their seats weeks in advance

title: Land for integrated check-posts in West Bengal in different stages¬†of acquisition: MHA
content: The West Bengal Government accorded approval for land acquisition only on November 21, 2023, and the Central Government has made the requisite payment to the State, Minister of State for Home Nityanand Rai said in a written reply to the Lok Sabha

title: BJP committing vote chori in collusion with Election Commission, says Rahul
content: The Congress leader claimed that the Modi government changed the law to give complete immunity to election commissioners for their decision but added, ‚Äúwe are going to change the law and going to find you‚Äù

title: Telangana‚Äôs EODB measures, infrastructure, talent come for praise
content: A senior official of the Industries Department urged entrepreneurs to make most of the measures, while refraining from incentive shopping

title: India has to move from service provider to a product nation by exploring energies technologies: Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: India‚Äôs maiden full-fledged summit on supercomputing kicks-off in Yelahanka. The five day event being held at Manipal Institute of Technology campus features advanced computer technologies by 175 firms.

title: Debate on Vande Mataram an attempt to divert attention from economic issues: Opposition
content: Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge said Parliament can pay true homage to Bharat Mata by discussing and resolving the issues of common people

title: Don‚Äôt sanction Eklavya schools until land already acquired: House panel tells govt.
content: Parliamentary Standing Committee on Social Justice and Empowerment notes that out of 722 sanctioned Eklavya schools for tribal students, 477 are functional, of which 341 are running from their own buildings and the rest operating in rented premises or other government buildings

I have already ordered notice in the contempt petition. It is beyond dispute that the order of this court has been breached repeatedly,‚Äù says Justice G.R. Swaminathan

content: The decision comes hours after the DGCA ordered a 5% reduction, citing the airline‚Äôs inability to operate its full approved schedule reliably

content: Accuses Congress of ‚Äòvote chori‚Äô in first LS poll; JD(U)‚Äôs Rajeev Ranjan Singh asks why Opposition parties only question EVMs when they lose elections; NCP (SP)‚Äôs Supriya Sule says ECI appears to be part of government

content: EC offers statistics in response to pleas for extension of deadlines by migrant workers in T.N., students in Kerala; SC says EC must protect BLOs along with States; EC blames hostile political parties for BLOs‚Äô stress

title: Mamata tears up Centre‚Äôs note imposing conditions on MGNREGA resumption in WB
content: ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt want your mercy,‚Äù says CM, rejecting conditions of an immediate labour budget, training; says State will expand its own Karmashree scheme instead; MGNREGA has been suspended in WB since March 2022

title: Watch: Manish Tewari questions Election Commission‚Äôs impartiality, calls for major reforms
content: Manish Tewari raises serious questions about the Election Commission‚Äôs impartiality and calls for major reforms in the selection process. He highlights concerns over EVM manipulation, advocates 100% VVPAT counting, and even suggests returning to paper ballots to restore public trust in democracy.

title: Ernakulam records 74.52% voter turnout in local body polls
content: The polling percentage surpassed the 2020 figure of 72.49% with municipalities recording 75.09% and tri-level panchayats 77.14% voter turnout

title: 'No Future If A Nation Doesn't Value History': Sadhguru On Vande Mataram Row
content: A nation that does not value its history cannot create a future for itself, Sadhguru Jaggi Vasudev, founder of Isha Foundation, told NDTV's Padmaja Joshi today.

title: Mehul Choksi's Appeal Against India's Extradition Request Rejected By Belgium's Supreme Court
content: Belgium's supreme court -- the Court of Cassation -- on Tuesday rejected the appeal of fugitive diamond trader Mehul Choksi challenging the extradition request of India.

title: Death Count In Deadly Hong Kong Fire Rises To 160
content: The death count in Hong Kong's worst fire in decades rose to 160 after an additional body was identified, police said on Tuesday, adding that six people were still listed as missing.

title: Caught Husband With Sister-In-Law, He Made Me Have Sanitiser: UP Cop
content: A police constable in Pilibhit registered a case against her husband, who is also a constable, and her in-laws, alleging that they demanded dowry and subjected her to cruelty, a police official said on Tuesday.

title: 22 Killed In Fire In 7-Storey Building In Indonesia's Capital Jakarta
content: A fire broke out at a seven-storey building in Indonesia's capital Jakarta on Tuesday, an official said on Tuesday, with 22 people confirmed dead.

title: Goa Club Fire: Repeated Warnings For Years, Zero Action, Then Disaster
content: The very construction of 'Birch by Romeo Lane' was patently illegal, documents accessed by NDTV show, and 25 lives could have been saved if action had been taken on the notices - including at least one for demolition - issued against the nightclub.

title: Punjab Man Wins Rs 1.5 Crore Lottery, Flees Home With Family Fearing Robbery
content: Joy and fear now go hand in hand for the family of this daily-wage worker in Punjab's Faridkot district, who recently won a lottery of Rs 1.5 crore.

title: Video: Pak Army Spokesman Winks At Reporter During Presser, Faces Backlash
content: Lieutenant General Ahmed Sharif Chaudhry, the Director General of Pakistan's Inter-Services Public Relations, faced extensive backlash after he winked at a journalist after answering her question regarding Imran Khan.

title: Delhi Jal Board Consultant, Named In Money Laundering Case, Dropped: Sources
content: The Delhi government has removed Senior Consultant in the Delhi Jal Board Ajay Gupta after it transpired that he is accused in a money laundering case filed by the Enforcement Directorate, top sources told NDTV.

title: Imran Khan's Sisters Protest Outside Adiala Jail Amid Health Concerns
content: The sisters of former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan held a protest outside Adiala Jail on Tuesday, voicing strong concerns over his health and safety in custody.

title: With Colleague In Ambulance, Bengal Poll Officials Stage Protest Over SIR
content: An association of West Bengal's Booth Level Officers on Tuesday staged a protest outside the Chief Electoral Officer, bringing a BLO in an ambulance, claiming that he suffered a severe brain stroke due to excessive stress during SIR duties.

title: 2 Separatists Arrested In 1996 Case Of Rioting And Firing On J&K Police
content: A nearly three-decade-old case involving charges of rioting, attempted murder, and unlawful activities has seen significant progress after fresh arrests in Srinagar this week.

title: High Percentage Of Indian Professionals Seek Self-Employment: Report
content: According to LinkedIn's latest Small Business Work Change India Report, the number of Indian members adding 'founder' to their profiles has increased by 104 per cent in a year.

title: Runaway Bride's Arrest Leads To Fake Marriage Racket Bust In Maharashtra
content: Police on Tuesday busted a gang which allegedly used to arrange marriages by taking money from grooms with the arrest of a woman in Beed district of Maharashtra, officials said.

title: Preparing 'Surgical Strike' To Identify Infiltrators: UP Government
content: The Yogi Adityanath government has prepared a comprehensive blueprint to carry out a "surgical strike" against infiltrators, aimed at strengthening the state's internal security.

title: Siddaramaiah Unveils World's Second Largest Khadi National Flag In Belagavi
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah on Tuesday unveiled the world's second-largest khadi national flag at the Suvarna Vidhana Soudha in Belagavi.

title: Uddhav Sena MLA Exposes Shinde Faction Rival With Cash Video; Sena says AI
content: Given the prolonged disarray within the Maha Vikas Aghadi, few expected the largely procedural, week-long winter session of the Maharashtra Assembly to spark major political turbulence.

title: Can Goa Club Owners, Hiding In Thailand, Be Extradited? What Treaty Says
content: Before India can put the Luthra brothers - Gaurav and Saurabh, owners of the Goa nightclub where a devastating fire killed 25 people - on trial for alleged negligence and murder, it has to get them back in the country.

title: Vibrant ‚ÄòKottikalasam‚Äô marks conclusion of hectic campaigning in Kannur, Kasaragod
content: In Kannur, the day remained largely peaceful, though a large police force was deployed to maintain law and order in view of the previous elections, while in Kasaragod, the ‚ÄòKottikalasam‚Äô peaked in Kanhangad town, where all three fronts are expected to face a close contest in the local body elections

title: Trade unions plan February general strike against Labour Codes
content: Ten central trade unions say Labour Codes must be withdrawn and prepare nationwide action aligned with wider protests

title: UDF rushing to offer clean chit to Jamaat-e-Islami, says Kerala CM
content: Pinarayi Vijayan alleges that the UDF is ready to align with organisations that have never been part of mainstream fronts, including those taking ‚Äúcommunal extremist positions‚Äù

title: Major fronts make last-ditch efforts to woo voters in Kozhikode
content: While the UDF focussed on the gold theft case at Sabarimala temple, the LDF raised the issue of ‚Äòtactical tie-up‚Äô between the Welfare Party of India and the UDF and highlighted¬†State government‚Äôs achievements during the campaign

title: Goa nightclub fire: Interpol issues Blue Notice against 2 owners
content: An Interpol colour-coded notice alerts all 196 member countries of the Lyon-based organisation about a member country‚Äôs request to find particular information

title: Electioneering ends on a high note in Palakkad
content: Sulthan Pet emerged as the focal point of the celebrations, where thousands converged and engaged in lively cultural shows, bike rallies, and spirited processions.

title: Chief of the Naval Staff embarks on official visit to Brazil
content: The visit, from December 09 to 12, is aimed at consolidating the robust and steadily expanding maritime partnership between the Indian Navy and the Brazilian Navy

title: Robots in classroom: Telangana‚Äôs ATCs to help students acquire Industry 4.0 skills
content: Deputy Chief Minister Mallu Bhatti Vikramarka, during a session at the summit, said the government is planning to increase the number of ATCs to 105 by setting up another 40 across the State

title: CBI registers loan fraud cases against Reliance ADA Group firms, searches premises of Anil Ambani‚Äôs son
content: Agency books RHFL and RCFL in major bank loan fraud probe and searches the Mumbai premises of Jai Anmol Ambani as part of its investigation

title: Congress leader slams State‚Äôs silence on Seeds Bill 2025 as ‚Äòpolitical surrender‚Äô
content: Bhargav says draft law strips States of powers, favours corporates and leaves farmers without protection; alleges government is complicit by refusing to oppose Centre‚Äôs move

title: Adequate urea stocks available for Rabi season, says official
content: Agriculture Director says steady supplies have eased shortage concerns and instructs districts to maintain a three-week buffer while intensifying farmer awareness on balanced urea use

title: Clashes erupt in Vanchiyoor over alleged bogus voting during local body polls
content: BJP workers accuse transgender voters of bogus voting, prompting a confrontation with CPI(M) cadre. Incidents of violence also reported in Karumam and Nedumangad

title: Palakkad sets up 2,749 polling booths; Tamil ballot labels in 93 wards
content: Around 28.6 lakh voters will cast their ballots from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. on Wednesday. In six grama panchayats near Tamil Nadu, ballot labels will feature candidates‚Äô names in Tamil, reflecting the region‚Äôs linguistic diversity.

title: Naidu seeks swift proposals for ‚Çπ40,000-cr Purvodaya plan to spur irrigation and rural growth
content: CM calls for major allocations to irrigation, horticulture, and infrastructure as he reviews key linkage projects and orders speedy execution across all regions of Andhra Pradesh

title: Mercury plunges to single digits in Ghat areas of Kerala
content: Mercury plunges to single digits in places such as Kundala dam on Monday night, where the lowest temperature of 7.5¬∞C was recorded, Munnar 9.4¬∞C, and Vattavada 9.7 ¬∞C

title: State to evolve transparent mechanism giving comfort to investors in Bharat Future City
content: Level playing field and transparent dispute resolution system will be put in place, says Minister Sridhar Babu

title: PNB bank scam: Belgium court rejects Choksi's plea; 'extradition to begin soon'
content: Belgium's Supreme Court has rejected Mehul Choksi's final appeal, allowing his extradition to India to proceed. The Antwerp Court of Appeal's earlier decision, clearing his extradition for the PNB fraud case, now stands. Choksi's claims of political motivation and forced removal were dismissed, with assurances of his welfare in Indian custody.

title: Hardik Pandya powers India to 101-run rout, SA bowled out for lowest T20I score ever
content: India began their T20 World Cup 2026 preparations with a dominant 101-run victory over South Africa. Hardik Pandya starred with an all-round performance. India's bowlers were disciplined, restricting South Africa to their lowest T20I total. The win gives India a 1-0 lead in the series. The next match is in New Chandigarh.

title: PIO nurse sentenced to jail in UK for raping and assaulting colleagues in care home
content: An Indian-origin nurse, Naijil Paul, has been sentenced to over seven years in jail in Scotland for raping a colleague and sexually assaulting two others. Paul fled to India before his 2019 trial but was extradited after six years. He pleaded guilty to the charges, which occurred in 2018 while he managed Acorn Park Care Home in Glasgow.

title: IndiGo crisis: Govt doubles flight cuts to 10%; airline to submit revised schedule
content: Aviation authorities have slashed IndiGo's winter flight schedule by 10% following widespread passenger disruptions. The airline, which previously faced a 5% cut, will now operate significantly fewer flights due to internal mismanagement of crew rosters and inadequate communication. This move aims to stabilize operations and reduce cancellations, with IndiGo submitting a revised schedule soon.

title: Technology company CEOs caught smuggling Nvidia GPUs worth $160m to China
content: US authorities have busted a major smuggling ring exporting over $160 million in advanced Nvidia AI chips to China. Operation Gatekeeper revealed a scheme using fake documents and shell companies. Executives face charges for illegally shipping high-end GPUs, crucial for AI and potentially military use, to restricted destinations. Several arrests and guilty pleas have been made.

title: Madrassa teacher held for raping minor in J&K‚Äôs Doda
content: A madrassa teacher has been arrested in Doda, Jammu and Kashmir, for allegedly raping a minor. Police apprehended the accused within three hours of the complaint, booking him under the Pocso Act and BNS. The swift arrest followed intelligence inputs and effective teamwork, with further investigation ongoing.

title: Rupee at 90 per US dollar: What is RBI doing to defend it? ‚ÄòSell $100m every minute‚Äô!
content: The Indian rupee is experiencing significant pressure, hitting record lows against the US dollar due to trade deficits, US tariffs, and capital outflows. The Reserve Bank of India is reportedly employing a sophisticated, unpredictable intervention strategy, communicating confidential directives to dealers to manage volatility without depleting reserves or hindering growth. This approach aims to curb speculation while maintaining market stability.

title: Marvin Harrison Jr injury update: Heel issue puts Week 15 return in doubt
content: Marvin Harrison Jr.'s rookie season faces another hurdle with a heel issue, sidelining him for Week 14 and making his Week 15 availability uncertain.  With the Cardinals out of playoff contention, they are unlikely to rush him back. Michael Wilson has stepped up significantly in Harrison's absence, capitalizing on increased opportunities and becoming a key offensive contributor.

title: Sam Altman says industry is wrong on OpenAI's competition, it is not from Google, but ...
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has declared Apple its ultimate rival, shifting focus from AGI to device-centric AI.  A 'code red' memo halts moonshot projects to boost ChatGPT's performance, driven by aggressive talent raids from Apple.  Meanwhile, Google's Gemini surges, forcing OpenAI to prioritize mass-market appeal and user feedback to regain dominance.

title: Canada‚Äôs C$1.7-bn research push targets global talent: Why Indian researchers should pay attention
content: Canada is rolling out a C$1.7-billion research funding push as uncertainty grips US campuses under shifting education policies. With fast-tracked visas and exemptions for doctoral students, Canadian universities are courting global talent. For Indian PhDs and postdocs, the move signals a shift in North America‚Äôs academic landscape ‚Äî from prestige alone to stability and predictability.

title: 'Gold medallist engineer': How Goa tragedy eclipsed Luthra brother' success; now absconding
content: Brothers Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra's rapid expansion of their Romeo Lane brand, fueled by a successful Goa outlet, has hit a tragic snag. Following a fatal incident at their 'island bar,' questions are mounting over safety clearances and operational oversight. Franchisees express disillusionment, and the brand faces an uncertain future amid industry calls for accountability.

title: Want to use your old smartphone as a home security camera? How to set it up
content: Transform your old smartphone into a home security camera with a simple app. This cost-effective DIY solution allows you to monitor your home, children, or pets remotely. By installing a security app on your old phone and your current device, you can set up a functional surveillance system. While convenient, be aware of limitations compared to professional cameras.

title: Mega investment: Nadella meets PM; Microsoft commits record $17.5bn for India's AI future
content: Microsoft is investing $17.5 billion in India, its largest investment in Asia, to bolster the nation's digital infrastructure and AI capabilities. CEO Satya Nadella announced the commitment following a discussion with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, aiming to support India's "AI first future" by developing essential infrastructure, skills, and sovereign capabilities.

title: SIP boom vs debt surge: Is India‚Äôs middle class getting richer or trapped?
content: India's middle class is embracing SIPs, with record contributions flowing into mutual funds. However, this financial sophistication masks a growing reliance on debt, as liabilities outpace asset growth. Many families are using credit to fund lifestyles and investments, creating a fragile financial situation despite the SIP boom.

title: Inside George Springer‚Äôs fairytale life with his wife Charlise Castro
content: Charlise Castro, a former Division I softball standout and America East Player of the Year, forged her own path beyond being George Springer's wife. After excelling in athletics, she pursued an MBA and built a credible career in wellness coaching, demonstrating ambition and resilience. Her journey highlights how partners of elite athletes can cultivate independent identities and success.

title: Ayesha Curry admits feeling anger when women try to pursue Stephen Curry
content: Ayesha Curry revealed on 'Red Table Talk' that she sometimes feels the urge to confront women who approach her husband, Stephen Curry, due to his naturally friendly demeanor. She later expressed regret about her appearance on the show, attributing the backlash to the platform's chaotic nature and the misinterpretation of her words.

title: Anna Kournikova & Enrique Iglesias 2025 net worth: Career, music and business
content: Tennis star Anna Kournikova and music icon Enrique Iglesias boast a combined net worth of $160 million in 2025. While Kournikova's fame transcended her $4 million prize money through lucrative endorsements, Iglesias' wealth stems from over 130 million record sales and global tours. Both have strategically invested in Miami real estate, contributing to their substantial shared fortune.

title: Is Leon Draisaitl playing tonight vs Sabres? Latest Dec 9 update
content: Edmonton Oilers' star Leon Draisaitl is confirmed to play tonight against the Buffalo Sabres, a crucial boost for the team's December momentum. Draisaitl, averaging over a point per game, remains a cornerstone of Edmonton's offense, vital for their home-ice advantage and pursuit of a key victory. His presence is expected to significantly impact the game's outcome.

title: Shocking stat: Why flying a passenger earns less than selling an iPhone cover, IATA explains
content: Airlines are projected to earn a meager $7.90 per passenger in 2026, a profit margin so low that Apple makes more selling an iPhone cover. Despite connecting economies and supporting millions of jobs, the aviation industry faces persistent headwinds like supply chain issues and delivery delays, capping profitability.

title: Drake London‚Äôs Week 15 status: Day-to-day or done for 2025?
content: Drake London has missed three straight games with a PCL sprain and opened Week 15 as a non-participant on Atlanta‚Äôs injury report. With the Falcons on a short week and already out of playoff contention, London‚Äôs chances of returning against the Buccaneers look slim. Here‚Äôs the latest timeline, reporting, and what it means for Atlanta and fantasy managers.

title: Pandya power: Hardik becomes 4th Indian to achieve this feat; joins Ro-Ko in elite list
content: Hardik Pandya made a triumphant return to cricket after a 74-day layoff, smashing an unbeaten 59 off 28 balls against South Africa. His explosive innings, featuring six fours and four sixes, propelled India to 175/6. Pandya also achieved a significant milestone, becoming the fourth Indian to hit 100 T20I sixes.

title: Dark side of the universe: Why black holes still pull us in
content: Black holes, born from dying stars, are cosmic giants that grow by consuming matter and merging with others. While invisible themselves, their feeding frenzy creates brilliant light. Despite their fearsome reputation and potential for spaghettification, these celestial bodies pose no threat to Earth and play a crucial role in shaping galaxies, revealing the universe's underlying patterns.

title: Historic! Another milestone for Messi: Argentina legend becomes first ever to ...
content: Lionel Messi has made MLS history by winning the MVP award for the second consecutive year, solidifying his status as a dominant force. Despite playing in only half the games, his remarkable performance of 29 goals and 19 assists led the league. Messi's commitment and unique talent have earned him widespread admiration and a clear-cut victory in this year's voting.

title: 'Had a disc bulge': Gill reveals neck injury details after return
content: Shubman Gill detailed his recovery from a neck injury, a disc bulge that impacted his nerves, which forced him out of action for nearly a month. After rehabilitation at the BCCI Centre of Excellence, Gill has been cleared and rejoined the Indian squad for the T20I series.

title: 'Years of experience but still lost my job,‚Äô shares employee: 5 ways to bounce back
content: Losing a job, especially early in a career, can be devastating, impacting more than just finances. A young professional's Reddit post highlights severe depression and a shattered sense of direction after a layoff. The article offers five practical strategies for navigating this disruption, including skill assessment, mentorship, and prioritizing mental well-being to regain career momentum.

title: Goa club fire: Portion of beach shack owned by Luthra brothers razed - watch
content: Days after a devastating fire at Birch by Romeo Lane claimed 25 lives, authorities demolished a section of the Romeo Lane restaurant in Goa's Vagator area. The structure, owned by Gaurav and Saurabh Luthra, was found to have encroached on the beach. Officials confirmed a 198-square-meter area was cleared.

title: 'Choose any day Samson over him': Gill fails on return; fans target 'poster boy'
content: Shubman Gill returned from injury but was out for just four runs in the first T20I against South Africa. He was dismissed early in the match. This performance drew criticism on social media. Gill had recovered from a neck injury. South Africa won the toss and chose to bowl.

title: 'Vote chori biggest anti-national act': Rahul in Lok Sabha during SIR debate; slams RSS
content: Rahul Gandhi accused the Election Commission of India of colluding with the BJP to rig elections, calling "vote chori" the biggest anti-national act. He questioned the removal of the CJI from the EC selection panel and alleged the RSS is capturing national institutions, including intelligence agencies and investigative bodies, to suppress opposition.

title: Goa club fire: Owner Gaurav Luthra spotted at Thailand airport; 1st image out
content: Goa nightclub owners, Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra, have fled to Thailand following a devastating fire that killed 25 people. Authorities issued a Look Out Circular and are coordinating with Interpol for their arrest.  Meanwhile, a third individual, Bharat Kohli, has been apprehended in Delhi and handed over to Goa police.

title: Smriti Mandhana updates Insta bio after wedding with Palash called off
content: Cricketer Smriti Mandhana confirmed her wedding to music composer Palash Muchhal has been called off, urging an end to speculation. Muchhal also stated he has "decided to move on" and warned of legal action against rumour-mongers. Mandhana emphasized her focus remains on representing India in cricket.

title: 'IndiGo back on its feet': CEO says ops stable; airline focusing on what led to crisis
content: IndiGo CEO Pieter Elbers assures operations are stabilizing after a recent crisis, with refunds issued and flights restored to all 138 destinations. The Civil Aviation Minister holds IndiGo accountable, emphasizing passenger convenience. The DGCA has mandated a 5% cut in IndiGo's winter schedule due to operational inefficiencies, with further reductions possible as the airline works to stabilize.

title: Dick Van Dyke reveals daily habits and lifestyle secrets to live beyond 100
content: Iconic entertainer Dick Van Dyke, nearing 100, shares his secrets to a vibrant life. His regimen includes daily exercise, yoga, and a playful spirit.  Van Dyke emphasizes embracing new experiences, maintaining strong social bonds, and crucially, abstaining from alcohol and cigarettes.  His optimistic outlook fuels his remarkable longevity and active engagement with the world.

title: Shami‚Äôs India snub: Ganguly questions Agarkar - 'Don't see any reason'
content: Mohammed Shami's stellar domestic form, bagging 11 wickets in three matches, sparks debate over his national team exclusion. Former BCCI chief Sourav Ganguly questions the selectors' decision, citing Shami's immense skill. Despite injury setbacks post-World Cup, the veteran pacer's experience could bolster India's bowling attack, especially in ODIs, ensuring a smooth transition.

title: Gill, Sudarshan, and gaps around them: What puzzles must GT solve at auction
content: With only 5 wins in 14 matches and a win percentage of 41.7, the 2024 season was a disaster for the Gujarat Titans as they finished 8th in the point table. However, GT had a good season last year after the mega auction and qualified for the playoffs, but were defeated in the Eliminator by the Mumbai Indians (MI).

title: Goa club fire: Shack owned by Luthra brothers to be razed; interpol notice out
content: Goa orders demolition of Romeo Lane nightclub after a fire killed 25. Investigations suggest deaths were avoidable, with senior IPS officers allegedly intervening to block previous notices and FIRs against the club. Call records of implicated officers may link them to club owners.

title: Brittany Mahomes goes silent after Mahomes-Kelce meltdown hits Chiefs
content: Kansas City Chiefs faced a tough loss against the Houston Texans. Quarterback Patrick Mahomes and player Travis Kelce struggled on the field. Brittany Mahomes, wife of Patrick Mahomes, remained silent on social media after the game. This quiet response mirrored the disappointment felt by many fans. The team's playoff hopes are now uncertain.

title: How a teammate with broken hand helped Sachin earn his India cap
content: Sachin Tendulkar recalled a 1989-90 Irani Cup match where Gursharan Singh batted with a broken hand to help Tendulkar reach his century. Singh's selfless act, despite his injury, allowed Tendulkar to score 103 runs and subsequently earn his India selection. Tendulkar expressed deep gratitude for Singh's remarkable gesture and commitment to supporting a teammate.

title: 'Was eying my elder daughter': Live-in partner slits techie's throat; calls cops to confess
content: A 35-year-old engineer was murdered by his 46-year-old live-in partner and her two daughters in Lucknow. The woman confessed to slitting his throat after an argument over his alleged "inappropriate intentions" towards her elder daughter. The deceased had been tutoring the daughters since 2012.

title: Will JEE Main and CUET shift to pen-and-paper after new recommendations by the parliamentary panel?
content: A parliamentary standing committee has highlighted repeated disruptions in major NTA exams, including UGC-NET, CSIR-NET, NEET-PG, NEET-UG, CUET and JEE Main. The panel recommended a shift towards pen-and-paper testing, citing successful CBSE and UPSC models, and urged that CBTs be held only in government-controlled centres. It also called for a nationwide blacklist of tainted vendors and advised using NTA‚Äôs Rs 448-crore surplus to strengthen internal exam capabilities and regulatory systems.

title: 'Falling' for him: Mistress dangles from 10th-floor balcony in China after lover‚Äôs wife returns home ‚Äî Watch
content: A woman, reportedly a mistress, narrowly escaped a perilous fall from a 10th-floor balcony in China after her lover's wife arrived unexpectedly. Witnesses watched in horror as she dangled precariously before sliding down drainpipes and windowsills to safety.  The incident, captured on video, has sparked widespread online discussion and embarrassment for those involved.

title: 'You were working for Britishers': Kharge flays BJP; Vande Mataram debate rages in RS
content: Rajya Sabha session on Vande Mataram's 150 years turned combative as Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge accused BJP's predecessors of working for the British. Home minister Amit Shah rejected claims of political timing, urging members to view the song's significance beyond elections.

title: 'Cheap sensationalism': Mahieka photographed inappropriately; Pandya hits out at paparazzi
content: Hardik Pandya strongly condemned paparazzi for intrusive photography of Mahieka Sharma, calling it disrespectful and cheap sensationalism. He urged the media to be more mindful and respect boundaries, emphasising that not everything needs to be captured. Meanwhile, Pandya is nearing a T20I milestone of 2,000 runs and 100 wickets.

title: Gabrielle Union says she and Dwyane Wade 'weren‚Äôt in a good place' when he fathered a child
content: Gabrielle Union has opened up about the devastation she felt when Dwyane Wade fathered a child with another woman during a brief breakup in 2013. Despite the trauma, the couple worked through the issue, with Wade admitting their marriage isn't perfect and requires ongoing effort. They reunited and married in 2014.

title: Indonesia fire: Massive blaze engulfs seven-story office building in Jakarta; 20 killed
content: A devastating fire ripped through a seven-storey office building in Jakarta, claiming at least 20 lives as smoke trapped workers inside. Flames erupted in the afternoon, spreading quickly and causing widespread panic. Firefighters battled the inferno, with dense smoke engulfing the area. Efforts to find survivors continued amidst the tragedy.

title: Jagan accuses Naidu of inflating GSDP figures to mask fiscal distress
content: YSRCP chief cites CAG data to allege severe financial mismanagement, record borrowings and declining consumption under the present regime

title: Cultural programmes mark first day of Amaravati Balotsav
content: Tourism Minister asks parents not to mount pressure on their wards and give them a chance to develop with their own ideas

title: Mind-boggling diversity is India‚Äôs  first obvious speciality: RSS chief Mohan¬†Bhagwat
content: Despite all diversities, we have been living as one ‚ÄòRashtra‚Äô for  eons. The very identity of our ‚ÄòRashtra‚Äô encompasses all diversities, he says at an event in Chennai to mark the RSS centenary celebrations

title: Take policy decision on allowing cinema halls in airports, Madras High Court tells Ministry of Civil Aviation
content: Justice M. Dhandapani permits PVR INOX to continue operating the five-screen multiplex at Chennai airport until the Centre takes a call on the matter

title: Karnataka to deploy AI-based Smart Enforcement System in 60 high-risk locations across the State
content: System will automatically generate digital challans and dispatch them to offenders through their registered email IDs and mobile numbers

title: Once his coaching mentor, could Pep Guardiola spell Xabi Alonso's end in Madrid?
content: pep Guardiola's side face real madrid in the champions league on saturday . Xabi Alonso was installed as a midfield general at bayer leverkusen in august 2014 . the spaniard says he learned so much when working for guardiola at the age of 32 .

title: 'It's an advantage': How post-ups became the NBA's most efficient play
content: post-ups were once a staple of inside-out offenses across the league . but by 2019, they'd been declining in frequency for years . in a post-game rant, a coach on the Dallas Mavericks explained why .

title: Barnwell sorts through NFL playoff race chaos: Are the Colts, Chiefs and Ravens finished?
content: every week of football in December is going to drive massive changes in the league's playoff picture . teams with realistic playoff aspirations were pitted against one another . there were four matchups between true playoff contenders on bye .

title: Eight teams, four matchups, one champ: Previewing the NBA Cup quarterfinals
content: the 2025 Emirates NBA Cup quarterfinals kick off on tuesday . leBron James goes off for 29 points to power the lakers to a close win over the 76ers . the team will have to advance without star Franz Wagner, who left the game because of a high ankle sprain .

title: Women's Bracketology: How the Big Ten is shaping the field
content: 16 new teams entered the bracket this week and 26 more moved at least one seed line . the big Ten was the exception for a conference that is consistently putting 13 teams in the field . Michigan State was held to just 64 points in a loss at Wisconsin .

title: How BYU built its roster to maximize the season of AJ Dybantsa
content: AJ Dybantsa announced his commitment to BYU in 2024 . the Cougars were the first five-star recruits since the ESPN recruiting database started in 2007 . a balanced mix of stars and role players has been a key factor for the team .

title: ‚ÄòSlop, rage bait': When language turns into warnings - what 2025 'Words of the Year' reveal about AI
content: 'words of the year' came from science, from art, from discovery . they named planets, ideas, emotions. they made language feel like progress . in 2025, the words made word feel like a warning .

title: US visa chaos: Many H-1B interviews cancelled; social media vetting rule set to kick in
content: Lubna Kably is a senior editor, who focuses on various policies and legislation. In particular, she writes extensively on immigration and tax policies. The Indian diaspora is the largest in the world; through her articles she demystifies the immigration-policy related developments in select countries for outbound students, job aspirants and employees. She also analyses the impact of Income-tax and GST related developments for individuals and business entities. Read More

title: 3 posers & 4 demands: Rahul stirs SIR storm in Lok Sabha; what he said on CJI, CCTVs
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. The TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape, ensuring that our readers are equipped with the latest developments that matter most."
